option.name: hub_enabled
option.short: Is server enabled
option.description: Use this to disable the hub for a while.

option.name: server_port
option.short: Server port to bind to
option.description: This specifies the port number the hub should listen on.

option.name: server_bind_addr
option.short: Server bind address
option.description:
Specify the IP address the local hub should bind to. This can be an IPv4 or IPv6 address, or one of the special addresses "any" or "loopback".
When "any" or "loopback" is used, the hub will automatically detect if IPv6 is supported and prefer that.
option.example:
To listen to a specific IP:
server_bind_addr = "192.168.12.69"

To listen to any IPv4 address:
server_bind_addr = "0.0.0.0"

Or to listen to any address including IPv6 (if supported):
server_bind_addr = "any"

option.name: server_listen_backlog
option.short: Server listen backlog
option.description:
This specifies the number of connections the hub will be able to accept in the backlog before they must be processed by the hub.

A too low number here will mean the hub will not accept connections fast enough when users are reconnecting really fast. The hub should under normal circumstances be able to empty the listen backlog several times per second.

option.name: server_alt_ports
option.short: Comma separated list of alternative ports to listen to
option.description: In addition to the server_port the hub can listen to a list of alternative ports.

option.name: show_banner
option.short: Show banner on connect
option.description: If enabled, the hub will announce the software version running to clients when they connect with a message like: "Powered by uhub/0.x.y"

option.name: show_banner_sys_info
option.short: Show banner on connect
option.description:
If enabled, the hub will announce the operating system and CPU architecture to clients when they join.
This option has no effect if show_banner is disabled.

option.name: max_users
option.short: Maximum number of users allowed on the hub
option.description: The maximum amount of users allowed on the hub. No new users will be allowed to enter the hub if this number is exceeded, however privileged users (operators, admins, etc) are still able to log in.
option.example:
To run a hub for max 25 users:
max_users = 25

option.name: registered_users_only
option.short: Allow registered users only
option.description: If this is enabled only registered users will be able to use the hub. A user must be registered in the acl file (file_acl).

option.name: register_self
option.short: Allow users to register themselves on the hub.
option.description: If this is enabled guests can register their nickname on the hub. Otherwise only operators can register users.

option.name: obsolete_clients
option.short: Support obsolete clients using a ADC protocol prior to 1.0
option.description: If this is enabled users using old ADC clients are allowed to enter the hub, however they cannot log in using passwords since the protocols are incompatible.

option.name: chat_is_privileged
option.short: Allow chat for operators and above only
option.description: If enabled only operators and admins are allowed to chat in the main chat.

option.name: hub_name
option.short: Name of hub
option.description: Configures the name of the hub

option.name: hub_description
option.short: Short hub description, topic or subject.
option.description: This is the description of the hub, as seen by users and hub lists.
option.example: hub_description = "a friendly hub for friendly people"

option.name: redirect_addr
option.short: A common hub redirect address.
option.description: This is the redirect address used when the hub wants to redirect a client for not fulfilling some requirements.

option.name: max_recv_buffer
option.short: Max read buffer before parse, per user
option.description: Maximum receive buffer allowed before commands are procesed. If a single ADC message exceeds this limit, it will be discarded by the hub. Use with caution.

option.name: max_send_buffer
option.short: Max send buffer before disconnect, per user
option.description: Maximum amount of bytes allowed to be queued for sending to any particular user before the hub will disconnect the user. The lower the limit, the more aggressive the hub will be to disconnect slow clients. Use with caution.

option.name: max_send_buffer_soft
option.short: Max send buffer before message drops, per user
option.description: Same as max_send_buffer, however low priority messages may be discarded if this limit is reached. Use with caution.

option.name: low_bandwidth_mode
option.short: Enable bandwidth saving measures
option.description: If this is enabled the hub will remove excessive information from each user's info message before broadcasting to all connected users. Description, e-mail address will be removed. This saves upload bandwidth for the hub.

option.name: max_chat_history
option.short: Number of chat messages kept in history
option.description: This specifies the number of main chat messages that are kept in the history buffer. Users can use the "!history" command to list these messages.

option.name: max_logout_log
option.short: Number of log entries for people leaving the hub
option.description: Operators can use the "!log" command to list users who have recently left the hub. This option specifies the maximum size of this log.

option.name: limit_max_hubs_user
option.short: Max concurrent hubs as a guest user
option.description: This limits the number of hubs a user can be logged into as a guest user. If this number is exceeded, the user will not be allowed to enter the hub.

option.name: limit_max_hubs_reg
option.short: Max concurrent hubs as a registered user
option.description: This limits the number of hubs a user can be logged into as a registered user. If this number is exceeded, the user will not be allowed to enter the hub.

option.name: limit_max_hubs_op
option.short: Max concurrent hubs as a operator (or admin)
option.description: This limits the number of hubs a user can be logged into as an operator. If this number is exceeded, the user will not be allowed to enter the hub.

option.name: limit_max_hubs
option.short: Max total hub connections allowed, user/reg/op combined.
option.description: Limit the number of hubs a user can be logged into in total regardless of registrations or privileges. If this number is exceeded, the user will not be allowed to enter the hub.

option.name: limit_min_hubs_user
option.short: Minimum concurrent hubs as a guest user
option.description: Only allow users that are logged into other hubs with guest privileges to enter this hub.

option.name: limit_min_hubs_reg
option.short: Minimum concurrent hubs as a registered user
option.description: Only allow users that are logged into other hubs as a registered user to enter this hub.

option.name: limit_min_hubs_op
option.short: Minimum concurrent hubs as a operator (or admin)
option.description: Only allow users that are logged into other hubs with operator privileges to enter this hub.

option.name: limit_min_share
option.short: Limit minimum share size in megabytes
option.description: Minimum share limit in megabytes (MiB). Users sharing less than this will not be allowed to enter the hub.
option.example:
To require users to share at least 1 GB in order to enter the hub:
limit_min_share = 1024

option.name: limit_max_share
option.short: Limit maximum share size in megabytes
option.description: Maximum share limit in megabytes (MiB). Users sharing more than this will not be allowed to enter the hub.

option.name: limit_min_slots
option.short: Limit minimum number of upload slots open per user
option.description: Minimum number of upload slots required. Users with less than this will not be allowed to enter the hub.

option.name: limit_max_slots
option.short: Limit minimum number of upload slots open per user
option.description: Maximum number of upload slots allowed. Users with more than this will not be allowed to enter the hub.

option.name: flood_ctl_interval
option.short: Time interval in seconds for flood control check.
option.description: This is the time interval that will be used for all flood control calculations. If this is 0 then all flood control is disabled.
option.example:
To limit maximum chat messages to 5 messages on 10 seconds:
flood_ctl_interval = 10
flood_ctl_chat = 5

option.name: flood_ctl_chat
option.short: Max chat messages allowed in time interval
option.description: If this is 0 then no flood control is disabled for chat messages.

option.name: flood_ctl_connect
option.short: Max connections requests allowed in time interval
option.description: If this is 0 then no flood control is disabled for connection requests.

option.name: flood_ctl_search
option.short: Max search requests allowed in time interval
option.description: If this is 0 then no flood control is disabled for search requests.

option.name: flood_ctl_update
option.short: Max updates allowed in time interval
option.description: If this is 0 then no flood control is disabled for info updates (INF messages).

option.name: flood_ctl_extras
option.short: Max extra messages allowed in time interval
option.description: Extra messages are messages that don't fit into the category of chat, search, update or connect.

option.name: tls_enable
option.short: Enable SSL/TLS support
option.description: Enables/disables TLS/SSL support. tls_certificate and tls_private_key must be set if this is enabled.

option.name: tls_require
option.short: If SSL/TLS enabled, should it be required
option.description: If TLS/SSL support is enabled it can either be optional or mandatory. If this option is disabled then SSL/TLS is not required to enter the hub, however it is possible to enter either with or without. This option has no effect unless tls_enable is enabled.

option.name: tls_require_redirect_addr
option.short: A redirect address in case a client connects using "adc://" when "adcs://" is required.
option.description: This is the redirect address used when the hub wants to redirect a client for not using ADCS. For instance a hub at adc://adc.example.com might redirect to adcs://adc.example.com

option.name: tls_certificate
option.short: Certificate file
option.description: Path to a TLS/SSL certificate or certificate chain (PEM format).

option.name: tls_private_key
option.short: Private key file
option.description: Path to a TLS/SSL private key (PEM format).

option.name: file_acl
option.short: File containing access control lists
option.description: This is an access control list (acl) file. In this file all registered users, bans, etc should be stored. If the file is missing, or empty no registered users, or ban records are used.
option.example:
Unix users:
file_acl = "/etc/uhub/users.conf"

Windows users:
file_acl = "c:\uhub\users.conf"

option.name: file_plugins
option.short: Plugin configuration file
option.description: Plugin configuration file.

option.name: msg_hub_full
option.description: This will be sent if the hub is full

option.name: msg_hub_disabled
option.description: This will be sent if the hub is disabled (hub_enable = off)

option.name: msg_hub_registered_users_only
option.default: Hub is for registered users only
option.description: This will be sent if the hub is configured to only accept registered users (registered_users_only = yes)

option.name: msg_inf_error_nick_missing
option.description: This is an error message that will be sent to clients that do not provide a nickname.

option.name: msg_inf_error_nick_multiple
option.description: This is an error message that will be sent to clients that provide multiple nicknames.

option.name: msg_inf_error_nick_invalid
option.description: This is an error message that will be sent to clients that provides an invalid nickname.

option.name: msg_inf_error_nick_long
option.description: This is an error message that will be sent to clients that provides a too long nickname.

option.name: msg_inf_error_nick_short
option.description: This is an error message that will be sent to clients that provides a too short nickname.

option.name: msg_inf_error_nick_spaces
option.description: This is an error message that will be sent to clients that provides a nickname that starts with a space.

option.name: msg_inf_error_nick_bad_chars
option.description: This is an error message that will be sent to clients that provides invalid characters in the nickname.

option.name: msg_inf_error_nick_not_utf8
option.description: This is an error message that will be sent to clients that provides a nick name that is not valid UTF-8 encoded.

option.name: msg_inf_error_nick_taken
option.description: This message will be sent to clients if their provided nickname is alredy in use on the hub.

option.name: msg_inf_error_nick_restricted
option.default: Nickname cannot be used on this hub
option.description: This message will be sent to clients if they provide a restricted nickname. Restricted names can be configured in the acl.

option.name: msg_inf_error_cid_invalid
option.description: This is an error message that will be sent to clients that provides an invalid client ID (CID)

option.name: msg_inf_error_cid_missing
option.description: This is an error message that will be sent to clients that does not provide a client ID (CID)

option.name: msg_inf_error_cid_taken
option.description: This is an error message that will be sent to clients that provides a client ID (CID) already in use on the hub.

option.name: msg_inf_error_pid_missing
option.description: This is an error message that will be sent to clients that does not provide a private ID (PID)

option.name: msg_inf_error_pid_invalid
option.description: This is an error message that will be sent to clients that provides an invalid private ID (PID)

option.name: msg_ban_permanently
option.description: This message is sent to users if they are banned (see acl)

option.name: msg_ban_temporarily
option.description: This message is sent to users if they are banned temporarily

option.name: msg_auth_invalid_password
option.description: This message is sent to users if they provide a wrong password.

option.name: msg_auth_user_not_found
option.default: User not found in password database
option.description: This message is used if a user cannot be found in the password database.

option.name: msg_error_no_memory
option.description: Hub has no more memory

option.name: msg_user_share_size_low
option.description: This message is sent to users if they are not sharing enough.

option.name: msg_user_share_size_high
option.description: This message is sent to users if they are sharing too much.

option.name: msg_user_slots_low
option.default: User have too few upload slots.
option.description: This message is sent to users if they do not have enough upload slots.

option.name: msg_user_slots_high
option.default: User have too many upload slots.
option.description: This message is sent to users if they have too many upload slots.

option.name: msg_user_hub_limit_low
option.default: User is on too few hubs.
option.description: This message is sent to users if they are on too few other hubs.

option.name: msg_user_hub_limit_high
option.default: User is on too many hubs.
option.description: This message is sent to users if they are on too many other hubs.

option.name: msg_user_flood_chat
option.default: Chat flood detected, messages are dropped.
option.description: This message is sent once to users who are flooding the chat.

option.name: msg_user_flood_connect
option.description: This message is sent once to users who are sending too many connect requests too fast.

option.name: msg_user_flood_search
option.default: Search flood detected, search is stopped.
option.description: This message is sent once to users who are sending too many search requests too fast.

option.name: msg_user_flood_update
option.description: This message is sent once to users who are sending too many updates too fast.

option.name: msg_user_flood_extras
option.description: This message is sent once to users who are sending too many messages to the hub that neither are chat, searhes, updates nor connection requests..

option.name: msg_proto_no_common_hash
option.description: This message is sent if a client connects that does support ADC/1.0 but not a hash algorithm that the hub supports.

option.name: msg_proto_obsolete_adc0
option.default: Client is using an obsolete ADC protocol version.
option.description: This message is sent if a client connects that does not support ADC/1.0, but rather the obsolete ADC/0.1 version.
